challenges.title: Introduction to the Web APIs and the DOM
description: When writing code for the Web with JavaScript, there are a great many application programming interfaces (APIs) available.
Part of the Web APIs is the Document Object Model (DOM).
The DOM allows programmatic access to change the HTML and CSS of a web page with JavaScript.

challenges.title: Documentation for the DOM
description: You will need documentation for the DOM.

The best documentation for the DOM is found on the Mozilla Developer Network (MDN).

You can find the MDN docs

here (developer.mozilla.org DOM)
You need to get very familiar with this site.
Try it out. Go to the DOM docs and look for the definition of HTMLBodyElement.

challenges.title: ** Read Professional JavaScript 8 through 14
description:
It is recommended that you read the chapters 8 through 14 (skip chapter 9) of the book:

Professional JavaScript for Web Developers

by Nicholas C. Zakas
Please commit to reading chapters 8 through 14 before you reach the Beginning Web Development lessons.
